moves.2... d5 3. h3: This is a waste of time.  My Bishop isn't going for f3, it's headed for f5 to trade-off White's only good bishop.
moves.3... Bf5 4. Nc3: 4...c3 or c4 might have been a better choice.
moves.4... Nc6 5. Bd3 e6 6. Bxf5 exf5: I'm already ahead in development and White's dark-squared bishop is out of the game.
moves.7. f3 g6 8. a3: White seems to be afraid of pins.  Doesn't he see all the dark-squared holes surrounding his king?
moves.8... Bh6 9. Nge2 Qe7 10. Nf4:
0-1

White forgets the pawn on e3 can't re-capture because of the pin on the king.
moves.15. Qc1: White knows trading is bad but the queen has nowhere good to go.
moves.15... Rhe8: Again, when ahead in material, trade-off.
